results.title: Immunization
results.brief_description: The external symptoms of disease, and how disease affects the blood-stream, are shown; immunity may be obtained from a disease either by contracting it and surviving, thus gaining (usually) active immunization; or by vaccination, which provides passive immunity, is just as effective, and does not endanger life.
results.description: The external symptoms of disease, and how disease affects the blood-stream, are shown; immunity may be obtained from a disease either by contracting it and surviving, thus gaining (usually) active immunization; or by vaccination, which provides passive immunity, is just as effective, and does not endanger life.

results.title: Immortal image
results.brief_description: Examines the sculpture of Ukrainian-born artist Leo Mol and follows his technique, the lost wax method, as he creates a portrait in bronze. Includes comments by the artist.

results.title: Immigration: the waves that shaped Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Dept of Immigration and Ethnic Affairs and Paul Woolston-Smith
results.brief_description: This video outlines the migrations which have made us what we are - starting with the arrival of the ancestors of the Aborigines, approximately 40,000 years ago. The landing on the 26th January, 1788, of the officers, marines and convicts of the First Fleet, started successive waves of mostly European migration whose cultures enriched our nation.

results.title: Immigration law: a delicate balance
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Arnie Gelbart
results.brief_description: The immigration law, and its enforcement, are examined in this documentary. It is a difficult exercise in which objective and non discriminatory criteria are applied in the screening of each prospective new Canadian. Case histories illustrate various aspects of this law.

results.title: Immigration
results.brief_description:
How the USA has been populated during the last two centuries. For many reasons people left the Old World to try their luck in the Americas - all have found a home in the USA during the past 200 years.
No credits available.

results.title: Immemory
results.brief_description:
Marker charts a haunting journey through memory, cinema, photography, war and literature tracing an itinerary or map of an imaginary country. This voyage takes us from the “Madeline” at the intersection of Proust and Hitchcock through an archive of image and text that culminates as a self-portrait.

(Electonic Arts Intermix)

results.title: Imitation of life [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ross Hunter, Universal International Pictures and Douglas Sirk
results.brief_description: Two widows, a rising actress and her African-American housekeeper, struggle in their relationships with their troubled daughters. As the years pass, each of the four women realises that she has been living out an emotionally fruitless existence. A film in which the conventions of the ‘woman’s weepie’ are manipulated in a melodramatic schema of American class and race relations. An ironic success story, the rise of Lora (Lana Turner) from housewife to actress, in the first half, merges into intensified melodrama on the theme of race and identity as a light skinned black woman tries to pass as white. Based on the novel by Fannie Hurst. Cast also includes John Gavin, Juanita Moore, Robert Alda, Susan Kohner and Sandra Dee.

results.title: Imants Tillers
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, Robert Lindsay, Michael Bongiovanni and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Imants Tillers along with Peter Myers and Peter Rees use the example of Bankstown, New South Wales to discuss the constructed and artificial landscape in terms of Australian culture and the relationship between art making and suburbinisation. Bankstown is a town constructed on landfill. It epitomises and celebrates the ‘height’ of suburban aesthetic values. Tillers, Myers and Rees explore themes of the ‘fulfilled suburban dream’, the suburban ‘visual’ language, Australian Futurism in architecture. Bankstown is the quintessential Australian suburb in its exuberance to express and celebrate urban pride. Some interesting observations are made along the way. The houses are: locked within parameters of essential design elements, with identical floor plans and no fence lines that allow each house to sit like artwork on walls for display reinstituting the notion of ‘promenade’. [PRINT IS A DUB-COPY]

results.title: Imagine, EC and me
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Ray Boseley, Brendan Maher, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Susie Campbell, Sandra Alexander, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
The Lift Off kids return in a brand new series with lots of fun and two new friends, Raph and Mario Ponti. We also meet Mr. Fish as a child in this delightful combination of songs and episodes. “Brand new”: EC and the Lift Off kids meet Raplh and Mario Ponti who arrive in time for Mario to help Nipper learn to rollerblade. “Under pressure”: Kim would do anything to be Princess Joanna in the school play, even trade EC! “Out of this world”: Aku’s goldfish Herbie is gone but not forgotten when he returns to haunt the plumbing! “Imagine EC and me”: Mr. Fish learns what it is like to be a child again with a little help from EC.
